subclass.name: Path of the Absent Titan
subclassFeatures: Path of the Absent Titan|Barbarian||Absent Titan|BlairsBundleofBuffs|3

subclass.name: College of the Untamed Wilds
subclassFeatures: College of the Untamed Wilds|Bard||Untamed Wilds|BlairsBundleofBuffs|3

subclass.name: Way of the Attuned Primordial
subclassFeatures: Way of the Attuned Primordial|Monk||Attuned Primordial|BlairsBundleofBuffs|3

subclass.name: Storm-Wracked Warden
subclassFeatures: Aegis of the Weathered Storm|Ranger||Storm-Wracked Warden|BlairsBundleofBuffs|7

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: Storing information in tomes, tablets, and scrolls is something that everyone has seen. Information archiving requires something to archive. Artificers who specialize in archiving work towards the goal of storing knowledge by creating artificial intelligence to store that for them.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with item {@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB} and the {@item forgery kit|PHB}. If you already have proficiency with either of these tools, you gain proficiency with another type of {@filter artisan's tools|items|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Archivist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Mind
entries: You discover how to awaken a mind inside an object. Whenever you finish a long rest and your calligrapher’s supplies are with you, you can magically rouse a keen mind within a Tiny, nonmagical object on which you write mystical symbols. The object is a magic item while the mind is inside it, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus. If you already have an artificial mind from this feature, the first one immediately dissipates.
The magic item has the following properties:

entries.caption: Artificial Mind
rows: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Survival}
A beast or a humanoid visage with antlers
A bespectacled visage or a treant

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Advisor
entries: The artificial mind telepathically supplies you with advice and information about certain topics: while the item is on your person, you have proficiency in two skills of your choice; the item’s main material determines which skills you can choose from, as shown on the Artificial Mind table in the Skill Proficiencies column, for the nature of the object affects the mind’s knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Mind
entries: As a bonus action while the item is on your person, you can cause the mind to manifest as a Tiny spectral presence, hovering in an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet of you. This presence is intangible and invulnerable, and it sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. You determine its appearance; the Artificial Mind table offers suggested appearances based on the object’s main material. While manifested, the spectral mind can hear and see, and it has darkvision with a range of 60 feet, and acts like a familiar under the {@spell find familiar} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Information Overload
entries: As an action while the item is on your person, you can try to magically overload the thoughts of one creature you or the mind can see that is within 5 feet of the manifested mind, channeling a jumble of information from the artificial mind. Unless the target succeeds on an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC, the target takes {@dice 1d8} psychic damage, and the next attack roll against it before the end of your next turn has advantage, since it is temporarily too distracted to defend itself well. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}) in this class.

Whenever you deal damage with this feature, you can expend a spell slot to deal extra damage to the target. The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than first.

subclassFeature.name: Information Highway
entries: While you have your Artificial Mind item on your person, you can communicate telepathically with anyone carrying an item bearing one of your Artificer Infusions or a spell scroll crafted by you, as the mind transmits your thoughts to each other. You can also communicate in this way with any creature within 60 feet of your Spectral Mind. This telepathic connection only works if you are on the same plane.

Additionally, a creature carrying a spell scroll that was created by you gains the ability to decipher it via your information highway. Even if a creature is unable to cast a spell on a spell scroll, by being able to telepathically interact with that creature, you give it the ability to cast the spell scroll.

subclassFeature.name: Scriber of Scrolls
entries: If you craft a magic item in the scroll category, it takes you a quarter of the normal time, and it costs you half as much of the usual gold. This does not stack with Magic Item Adept.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Mind
entries: Your artificial mind can use your Information Highway to grant a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier proficiency in the same skills as your Telepathic Advisor feature. This feature ends after 10 minutes or you fall unconscious.
Once you do this, you cannot do so again until after you long rest or you expend a first level spell slot to do it again.

subclassFeature.name: Pure Information
entries: Your Artificial Mind is able to receive and transmit more information than ever before:

subclassFeature.name: Mind Overload
entries: When you expend a spell slot to increase the damage of Information Overload, the target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infoportation
entries: As an action while your Artificial Mind magic item is on your person, you cause the mind to turn you into pure information, teleporting you to the unoccupied space nearest to the spectral mind or to an item bearing one of your artificer infusions, where you physically reappear.

subclassFeature.name: Merchant
entries: In Bytopia, where innovation and enterprise reigns supreme, these artisans weird their ingenuity and craftsmanship to shape the very foundation of Bytopian trade. In the town of Yeoman, nothing is mass produced, everything has a crafter’s care and love put into its every inch.

subclassFeature.name: Peddler's Knowledge
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you become proficient in both the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} skills.

In addition, when you take at least a minute to examine someone’s wares, you can make an Intelligence check against the merchant’s Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) or Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. If your Intelligence check is higher, you can figure out the real price of the item in gold. This amount does not include taxes, trades, or deals.

subclassFeature.name: Merchant Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Merchant Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Purchase
entries: You seem to always have just the thing for the situation. As an action, you can dig around in your bag and find something you’ve bought from your last shopping trip. Doing so, you can pull out an item. This item must be a piece of nonmagical adventuring gear and it must not weigh enough to make you encumbered. When you pull it out of your bag, spend the amount of gold you would have spent buying it.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Caster's Trade Secrets
entries: When you cast a spell, you now have the option to cast it into a small bead for safe keeping or to sell to others. Anyone who uses that bead can now use their action to cast that spell, regardless of their ability to cast spells. This bead uses your Spell Save DC and Spell Attack bonus. This bead lasts until used or whenever you complete a long rest.
You can also add your Intelligence modifier to the damage you deal with any cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Bottom of Your Bag
entries: All these items you keep premptively purchasing keeps falling to the bottom of your bag, as well as your prototypes. You can now use your Predictive Purchase feature an amount of times equal to your Intelligence modifer.

In addition, your makeshift, prototype infusions find your way down there as well. As an action, you can pull an infused item out of the bottom of your bag. This is a prototype and only lasts for 10 minutes before breaking and it does not count against your Infused Item limits. If it requires being on an item, you must spend the gold cost of the nonmagical version of that item to use this feature, if you do not have something that already suffices.

subclassFeature.name: Big Spender
entries: As you’ve made more deals and gotten better at the quality of parts, your prototypes and predictive purchases have gotten better. Once per week, you can use your Predictive Purchase to pull out a Common or Uncommon magic item. This item cannot be a weapon or a set of armor. You still need to spend the gold cost to retrieve this item.
In addition, the parts you make your prototypes out of have improved greatly, making them last longer. Your prototypes now last 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Absent Titan
entries: Barbarians that follow this path embodies the essence of Epimetheus, a titan whose actions are driven more by impulse than strategy. Barbarians who follow this path are unpredictable forces of nature, even to themselves.

Like the wandering titan in Bytopia, they possess incredible potential, though their actions are haphazard and unpredictable. Unfocusing, they find it hard to focus on the single enemy, swapping from target to target until they’re all dead.

subclassFeature.name: Burst of Knowledge
entries: While unfocused, when pressured and motivated, you can be quite intelligent. Gain two proficiencies from {@skill Arcana|}, {@skill History|}, {@skill Investigation|}, {@skill Nature|}, and {@skill Religion|}.

When needed to focus on a short term task, through sheer strength you are able to force your mind to stay on track. As part of making an ability check involving Intelligence or Wisdom, you can add your Strength modifier. This can be a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and you gain all uses back during a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Distracted Warrior
entries: You find it hard to focus on just one target, but that’s where you draw your strength. Whenever you attack a creature that is different from the last creature you’ve attacked, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage.
This damage is increased up to {@dice 2d6} at level 10.
Also, as your mind floats beyond the battlefield, you can use your reaction to drift away from your current position, moving half your movement towards a different, hostile creature.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Form
entries: Your rages pull strength from the primal might of Epimetheus, transforming you into a hulking force of destruction. While raging, you gain the following benefits:

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Stature
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet, and if you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn’t enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn’t change.

subclassFeature.name: Impulsive Aggression
entries: If you hit an enemy while attacking recklessly during your turn, they can no longer take opportunity attacks against you and if they are effected by your Distracted Warrior feature, they take {@dice 1d6} additional damage.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Wanderer
entries: In the footsteps of Epimetheus, you wander everywhere, both physically and mentally. You are not effected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If you are making a saving throw against something trying to reduce your movement speed or affect your mind, you make the saving throw at advantage.
In addition, your Distracted Warrior damage increases to {@dice 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Epimetheus' Blessing
entries: The titanic power of your rage intensifies. When you rage, your reach increases by 10 feet, your size can increase to Large or Huge (your choice), and you can use your Burst of Knowledge feature at will.
In addition, your Intelligence increases by 2. Your maximum for Intelligence is now 22.

subclassFeature.name: College of the Untamed Wilds
entries: Bards of this college spend most of their time in the Shurrock or other places of unkept wilderness. With their audience mainly encompassing beasts who wander up, they’ve created a knack for luring animals. Bards who joined this college feel a kinship to the natural world and spend their time in the wild, and are often more comfortable with nature than they are with people.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Envoy
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling}. If you already have proficiency with Animal Handling, you can instead gain expertise. Whenever you make an Animal Handling check with a beast, you can use your Charisma instead of Wisdom.

In addition, beasts can understand your speech, and you gain the ability to decipher their noises and motions. Most beasts lack the intelligence to convey or understand sophisticated concepts, but a friendly beast could relay what it has seen or heard in the recent past. This ability doesn’t grant you friendship with beasts, though you can combine this ability with gifts to curry favor with them as you would with any nonplayer character.

subclassFeature.name: Wing Man
entries: You can summon a beastial creature from the wilds nearby, or if no other option, a beastial spirit that lingers in the area. As an action, you can expend one use of your bardic inspiration feature to summon your beastial companion and chose between three environments: Air, Land, or Water.

The beast appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. The beast is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature’s game statistics in the {@creature Wing Man|BlairsBundleofBuffs} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the beast’s appearance.

In combat, the beast shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take an action or bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the beast can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.
The beast manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you use this feature to summon a Wing Man again.

subclassFeature.name: Wing Man's Charm
entries: Your Wing Man might be more inspiring than you yourself. If you use a Bardic Inspiration on your Wing Man, you can also give it a command to take another action other than Dodge.
In addition, you can give another Bardic Inspiration dice to an ally within 30ft of your Wing Man, without expending an additional usage.

subclassFeature.name: Companionship
entries: Throughout your travels, you’ve emassed several Wing Mans that particularly liked you. You now have one permanent Wing Man that travels along side you. You can swap out their form at the end of a short or long rest. This one does not count for your Wing Man feature. You can command them both with the same bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: College of the Whisperleaf
entries: Bards that follow this college are mischievous minstrels, weaving tales of laughter under the watchful boughs of Baervan Wildwanderer’s domain. Infused with the playful spirit of Whisperleaf, these bards wield enchanted weapons created from the tree, blending song and pranks in equal measure. Masters of practical jokes, they delight in the art of thievery, their mischief tempered by whisical charm.

subclassFeature.name: Prankster's Training
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Stealth} skills. In addition, you have studied the parts of every language that’s important, you are able to insult and mock someone in any language, even if you aren’t proficient in it. You gain the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip, if you already know it, gain one bard cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Whisperleaf's Gift
entries: Even as you leave your home, the Whisperleaf tree still aids your path. At the end of your long rest, you can touch one weapon predominantly made of wood to give it the blessing of the Whisperleaf. While under this blessing, you can use your Charisma for your attack and damage rolls using that weapon.
This blessing lasts indefinitely, but when you die, the blessing vanishes after a number of days have past equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: It's Just a Prank
entries: As a bonus action, you can attempt to prank someone within 5ft of you. It must make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) or Dexterity (Stealth) check. If you succeed, as part of your attack action with a weapon blessed by the Whisperleaf, you can also cast Viscious Mockery to taunt them for falling for your prank.

subclassFeature.name: Laughing Stock
entries: Your pranks can’t get old. As a reaction, if someone fails against your It’s Just a Prank feature, you can point and laugh, making sure all allies within 30ft who can see you see what happened. When you do so, Use one of your Bardic Inspiration dice and roll it, all your allies can add the number rolled to their next Attack Roll, Ability Check, or Saving Throw.

subclassFeature.name: Gnome Domain
entries: Clerics of the Gnome Domain pray not to one god, but the entirety of the gnomish pantheon, also known at the Lords of the Golden Hills. These gods are generally playful pranksters, lovers of nature, and intelligent crafters and collectors.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Gnome Domain Spells table.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You learn the {@spell Minor Illusion} and {@spell Friends} cantrips. These cantrips don’t count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. Additionally, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Persuation}, or {@skill Sleight of Hand}.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Trickery
entries: Your pranks themselves are infused with divine magic. Whenever someone tries to discern if a harmless illusion from you is real or not, add your Proficiency bonus to the DC.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Quick-Crafted Gizmo
entries: Whenever you Ready an action, you expend a channel divinity and focus the divine magic of your gods to quickly create a contraption. When you do so, instead of holding the action normally, you instead create a tiny object that takes the form of your choosing that you are holding.
When using your Quick-Crafted Gizmo, you cannot use your reaction to trigger or ignore it, instead it can only go off based on the trigger you decided for it.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Practicing
entries: Whenever you are concentrating on a spell, you can also concentrate on an illusion spell of 3rd level or lower. They share your concentration and if you fail a concentration check, both the spells end.

When you cast an an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use your action to change the nature of that illusion (using the spell’s normal parameters for the illusion), provided that you can see the illusion.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Incarnate
entries: Your gnomish cunning excels to nearly match the level of your gods. You gain proficiency in Intelligence Saving Throws. You can also choose one of the saving throws you’re proficient in, you can now add double your proficiency bonus to it.
In addition, as a reaction when you see someone within 30 feet of you make a Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom saving throw, you can make them make their saving throw at advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Luck Domain
entries: Gods of luck represent and control the innate feature of luck that affects people in their every day life. Though risk takers are ones who are favored by those gods. Gamblers, adventurers, and the innately unlucky tend to follow these gods to gain an edge in their risky endevours.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Luck Domain Spells table.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with two {@filter gaming set|items|type=gaming set} of your choice. You also become proficient in one of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Investigation.}

subclassFeature.name: Fortune Favors the Bold
entries: You learn the {@spell guidance} and {@spell resistance} cantrips and they now have a range of 30 feet. In addition, you can use either of them as a bonus action, You can only use them as a bonus action an amount of times equal to your wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Bout of Luck
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to tap into a reserve of luck. You use an action and declare yourself to have a lucky streak for 1 minute. When you cast this, and at the beginning of your turn, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature is under the effect of either the {@spell bless} and {@spell guidance} or {@spell bane} spell until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Karmic Favor
entries: Whenever an ally within 30 feet of you critically hits with an attack, your able to reward them for their streak of luck. As a reaction, you can have them roll one additional damage die when determining the extra damage for the critical hit.
You cannot use this feature again unless you use a reaction when an enemy within 30 feet of you critically fails an attack roll or you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip. In addition, when you make a spell attack roll, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Luckiest Man Alive
entries: You’ve gotten so close to your deity that luck washes over you and your allies constantly. When you cast {@spell guidance} and {@spell resistance} or come under effects of those spells, you can now roll 2d4 and add the number rolled.
In addition, you can now use Karmic Favor on allies when you critically fail to regain the feature. When you do, they can reroll the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Protection Domain
entries: The protection domain is the purview of deities who charge their followers to shield the weak from the strong. The gods’ faithful dwell in villages and near the entrances to Sharrock, where they help bolster defenses and seek out evils to defeat. These gods believe that a strong shield and a suit of armor is the best defense against evil, second only to a stout mace on hand to respond to any attacks in kind. Deities who grant this domain include Bahumut, Ilmater, Tefnut, Gaerdal Ironhand, Garl Glittergold, and Gorm Gulthyn.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Protection Domain Spells table.

entries.caption: Protection Domain Spells
rows: {@spell compelled duel}, {@spell protection from evil and good}
{@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Shield of the Faithful
entries: You gain the ability to hinder attacks intended for others. When a creature attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. To do so, you must be able to see both the attacker and the target. You interpose an arm, a shield, or some other part of yourself to try to throw the attack off target.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Radiant Defense
entries: You can evoke your Channel Divinity to cloak your allies in radiant armor. As an action, you choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of one). They each gain temporary hit points equal to a {@dice 1d6} + your cleric level.

You can use your reaction when someone under this Channel Divinity’s effect takes damage, where you magically protect them from harm. That person gains resistance to that source of damage, and you both take that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Healer
entries: The healing spells you cast on others can heal you as well. When you cast a spell with a spell slot and it restores hit points to any creature other than you this turn, you regain hit points equal to 2 * the spell’s level.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your weapons with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a spell or weapon attack, you can cause the spell or attak to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Indomitable Defense
entries: You gain resistance to two damage types of your choice. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can change the damage types you chose.

As an action, you can temporarily give up this resistance and transfer it to one creature you touch. The creature keeps the resistance until the end of your next long rest or until you transfer it back to yourself as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Dothion
entries: Dothion is a orderly and domesticated landscape. Farms prosper, the weather is fair and calm, and everyone there works with the nature instead of tearing it apart for industry. These druids embodies that spirit of orderly landscape, planting magical seeds and attuning to the natural elements to nurture and protect their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your link with the land of Dothion and the peaceful countryside grants you access to certain spells. You learn the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn’t appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.caption: Circle of Dothion Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell guardian of nature|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Dothion Attunement
entries: While Dothion fights against large environmental changes, being intune with it helps you fight against that. While casting any spells that Dothion would resist, such as an Earthquake or Plant Growth, you can cast those spells without issue.
In addition, no plant creatures will attack you or your allies unless attacked first while on Dothion.

subclassFeature.name: Bountiful Harvest
entries: As an action, you can expend a use of your wild shape feature to magically sow the ground beneath you and have seeds start to sprout in an area of 10 feet times half your druid level. Depending on the seed type, different effects happen:
Your Bountiful Harvest lasts for one minute or until you use a use the feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Weeds
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can send out weeds to grab at and attack enemies within the area. The creature being attacked must make a Dexterity saving throw. If they fail, they take {@dice 1d8} + your Spellcasting modifier. If they fail by 5 or more, they are grappled until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Thriving Berry Bushes
entries: As a bonus action, any friendly creature can eat a berry. When they eat a berry, they gain {@dice 1d6} plus your wisdom modifier in Temporary hit points until your Bountiful Harvest ends. In addition, when someone that you can see eats a berry, you can use your reaction to instead turn the temporary hit points into normal hit points. When you do this, expend one hit dice.

subclassFeature.name: Guiding Sprouts
entries: Whenever a friendly creature is in this area, they gain advantage whenever trying to do any Strength or Dexterity based checks and saves as these sprouts support and guide their movements. In addition, their movement speed also increases by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mixed Agriculture
entries: Whenever you use your Bountiful Harvest feature, you can now pick two of the seed types. In addition, whenever you use the mold earth cantrip you can also use it to create a temporary effect of your Bountiful Harvest in the 5ft area effected. It lasts until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature an amount of times equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Plant Breeding
entries: Over time growing plants, you have learned how to make them stronger and better at their purposes. All the seeds apart of your Bountiful Harvest have improved:

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Weeds
entries: Whenever you use your bonus action to use this feature, they instead target two people within the radius and deal an extra {@dice 1d8} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Thriving Berry Bushes
entries: Instead of your hit dice, someone eating the berry can use their own reaction to expend their own hit dice. If you use your hit dice to empower a berry, the healing effect is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Guiding Sprouts
entries: In addition to guiding your movement or being strong, they can now push your feet to help you dodge attacks. Whenever someone is getting attacked in the radius of the effect, you can use your reaction to empower the sprouts, hopefully causing them to miss. When taking this reaction, you can roll a {@dice d6} and subtract it from either the attack roll or the damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Farmer
entries: You’ve been farming and learning every trick you can. When you use your Bountiful Harvest feature, you can have all three effects active.
In addition, you know are immune to the disease and poisoned conditions, have resistance to acid and poison damage, and all plant creatures attacking you are at disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Shurrock
entries: Shurrock is home to many strange anomolies, but a main one for these druids are the beasts. Home to abnormally large and aggressive beasts that roam the realms of Shurrock, these druids reflect the primal forces that define their layer of Bytopia. As they stride through the mountainous lands of Shurrock, these attune to the untamed forces that shape the heart of its primal magic.

subclassFeature.name: Ravaging Wild Shapes
entries: Whenever you use the Wild Shape action on your turn, you have the option to turn into a much larger version of your beast of choice. When you do, your Wild Shape becomes one size category larger.

In addition, whenever you wild shape, your form gains additional HP equal to your Constitution modifier per hit dice of the form you take. (For example, if you have a +2 Constitution Modifier and turn into a Crocodile, you would gain an additional 6 hit points.)

subclassFeature.name: Circle Forms
entries: The rites of your circle grant you the ability to transform into more dangerous animal forms. Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Wild Shape to transform into a {@filter beast with challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=beast} (you ignore the Max. CR column of the Beast Shapes table, but must abide by the other limitations there).
Starting at 6th level, you can transform into a beast with a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, rounded down.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Strike
entries: Your attacks in beast form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Storming Retribution
entries: You can now tap into the chaotic storms of Shurrock, using that magic to rebuke attacks in towards you and impower your strikes. Once per turn, you can add {@dice 1d6} Lightning damage to an attack that hits an enemy.

In addition, when someone within your reach hits you with an attack you can see, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot. If you do, the attacker must make a Dexerity Saving Throw against your DC or take lightning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} per level of spell slot used.

subclassFeature.name: Colossal Wild Shape
entries: Empowered greatly by the layer of Shurrock, you have the option to wild shape using even more of the primal magic. By expending two uses of your wild shape form, you can augment your wild shape even further. You gain the following buffs:

items: You are two size categories larger than the original form of the Beast.
Your reach for all attacks gain 10ft of reach.
You can now take the maximum roll of the hit dice of the beast to determine your max HP.

subclassFeature.name: Extradimensional Armory
entries: A fighter is nothing without their weapons, so these warriors have unlocked the secrets of a small demiplane, where an arsenal of weapons and armor awaits their beck and call. With practiced skill and a touch of otherworldy finesse, they can seamlessly swap out their equipment in the heat of battle. With a collection of magical weapons and armor, these fighters are masters of adaptability.

subclassFeature.name: Extraplanar Armory
entries: You learn an hour long ritual that connects to a demiplane that can store weapons and armor that can be done during a short rest. When performing this ritual, you can place one weapon or armor in the demiplane or take one out. If you are placing equipment in, it must be within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch it and connect it to your armory.

Once a weapon or armor has been placed in your armory, you can’t be disarmed of it and if you drop it or if it is removed from you, it returns safely to your Extraplanar Armory. If you focus for one minute, you can summon an equipment from your armory into your hand if it is a weapon, or don it if it is armor. If you are previously wearing armor or holding a weapon, it is placed in an unoccupied space within 5ft of you.

subclassFeature.name: Quickswap
entries: In addition, your skill with this demiplane allows you to quickly swap weapons in combat. As a bonus action, you can summon an equipment from your Extraplanar Armory. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your fighter level. You regain any expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Plane
entries: As you’ve used your Extradimensional Armory, you’ve grown more familiar with how it works, allowing you to use it for more than just weapons and armor. You learn the spells {@spell wristpocket|EGW} and {@spell rope trick}. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell again until you finish a long rest. The spell’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

subclassFeature.name: Conjured Guard
entries: The armor in your Armory doesn’t need to be on you to protect you. As a reaction when another creature hits you and you aren’t surprised, you can use one of your Quickswaps to summon a set of armor briefly to block the attack. This gives you an AC bonus based off the armor used to block the attack, +1 for light, +2 for medium, and +3 for heavy, also gaining any magical effects from the armor used.
Once a set of armor is used to block the attack, it cannot be used again until you have completed a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Instant Swap
entries: You’ve honed your strength with your Extradimensional Armory making it effortless to swap between your weapons. When you make an attack roll, you can expend one use of your Quickswap to summon a weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Demiplane Mastery
entries: You are unmatched in control of your demiplane. You can now use your Quickswap ability at will. As well, your demiplane is stable enough to support people as well as equipment. Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell Mordenkainen's magnificent mansion} using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. When casted this way, your servants are the weapons and armor you’ve placed in your armory, and you must have a blacksmith as part of your floor plan.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Attuned Primordial
entries: Ancient primordials hide themselves away in the elemental planes and the elemental chaos around them. Monks who follow the Way of the Attuned Primordial resonate with these elemental planes and the primordial beings within, using it as a way to alter their spirit with elemental magic

Monks who follow this style train nearby portals to the elemental planes, in extreme conditions representative of those planes, or have directly trained under strong elementals who can show them how to channel the elements.

subclassFeature.name: Sense Elements
entries: Your training has given you the ability to sense strong connections to the elemental planes. As an action, you can expend a Ki point to detect the distance and direction of the nearest portal to the elemental planes and elemental within 1 mile of you. You know the plane the portal connects to and the type of elemental when you use this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Flow State
entries: As part of training under the effects of the elemental planes, you choose an element and gain its features. Your element might portray itself in supernatural features, for example, if you are attuned to the elemental plane of fire, if you walk on grass, it might get singed.

As part of this, you also gain access to an Elemental Flow State. As a bonus action and by expending 1 Ki point, you can enter your Elemental Flow State, gaining additional features based off your element. This lasts for 1 minute unless you become incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Air
entries: You learn the {@spell gust|XGE} cantrip and use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for it and whenever you hit an attack using an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, you can deal lightning damage instead of the damage the attack would deal normally.

In addition, whenever you are in your Elemental Flow State, whenever you deal damage to someone using an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, you can push a creature 5 feet in a direction of your choice. You can only do this once per turn unless you spend a Ki point to do it again.

subclassFeature.name: Earth
entries: You learn the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip and use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for it and whenever you hit an attack using an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, you can deal thunder damage instead of the damage the attack would deal normally.
In addition, whenever you are in your Elemental Flow State, increase your AC by half of your Proficiency Bonus as rocks collect and form a defense around you.

subclassFeature.name: Fire
entries: You learn the {@spell control flames|XGE} cantrip and use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for it and whenever you hit an attack using an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, you can deal fire damage instead of the damage the attack would deal normally.

In addition, whenever you are in your Elemental Flow State, you gain the ability to use your reaction in response to somebody dealing damage to you within 30 feet. When you do so, you light them on fire, dealing a roll of your Martial Arts die at the end of their turn unless a creature spends an action putting out the fire.

subclassFeature.name: Water
entries: You learn the {@spell shape water|XGE} cantrip and use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for it and whenever you hit an attack using an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, you can deal cold damage instead of the damage the attack would deal normally.
In addition, whenever you are in your Elemental Flow State, your can use long whips of water to do your unarmed strikes. When using the whips, your unarmed strike range is increased by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Empowerment
entries: You gain another beenfit based on an element of your choice. You can choose the same element you selected at 3rd level or a different one.
When you enter your Elemental Flow State or if you spend a Ki point during your turn while in Flow State, you gain the following effects based on your element:

subclassFeature.name: Air
entries: You gain the ability to temporarily fly as you invoke the wind to empower your movement. You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Earth
entries: You call upon rocks to deflect against damage coming towards you, gaining an amount of temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. These temporary hit points go away at the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fire
entries: You cause the area around you to grow scalding hot. Until the start of your next turn, if an enemy ends its turn within 15 feet of you, they take an amount of fire damage equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Water
entries: You give yourself or your companions the ability to move like water. Until the start of your next turn, if an ally is within 30 feet of you is gets hit with an attack roll or forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to give the attack roll disadvantage or give the Dexterity saving throw advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Awakening
entries: In addition to your current creature type, you are also an Elemental. You gain resistance to the type of damage you gained from your 3rd level element choice.
You gain the ability to cast {@spell summon elemental|TCE} at its lowest level. Once you do this, you cannot do so again unless you long rest or expend 5 Ki points.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Mastery
entries: You gain another magical benefit based on an element of your choice. You must chose an element you’ve chosen before or a quasi-element if you meet the prerequisite elements stated next to them.

subclassFeature.name: Air
entries: You can move like the wind. When you move on your turn, you don’t provoke opportunity attacks. When you enter your Elemental Flow State and at the start of your turn while in your flow state, you can choose a willing ally within 60 feet of you and move them to an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Ash (Air and Fire)
entries: You eyes have adjusted to the ash and particles in the air. You gain blindsight out to 15 feet. While in your Elemental Flow State, a cloud of ash is formed in an 20 foot radius around you. Allies have no problem seeing through the cloud, but enemies who start their turn in it must make a Consitution saving through against your Ki save DC or be blinded until the start of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Earth
entries: You become as strong as a rock. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. While in your Elemental Flow State, if damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 ki point to instead drop to 1 hit point.

subclassFeature.name: Fire
entries: You invoke fire with every breath you take. You are immune to fire damage. By expending 3 Ki and using an action while in your Elemental Flow State, you can conjure a ball of fire around yourself. Every creature within 20 feet of you must make a Dexterity Saving against your Ki save DC, taking {@dice 6d6} fire damage on a fail, or half as much on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Ice (Air and Water)
entries: You are one with the cold, slippery ice. You are immune to difficult terrain and all Wilderness Hazards. While in your flow state, a 40-foot area around you is covered in Slippery Ice that only effects your enemies. This Slippery Ice uses your Ki save DC instead of it’s normal DC when determining if a creature falls prone.

subclassFeature.name: Magma (Earth and Fire)
entries: Like magma, you flow slowly and are difficult to stop. Whenever you use your bonus action to use Patient Defense, you can make an unnarmed strike as part of it. While you are in your Elemental Flow State, your unarmed strikes deal additional fire damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Ooze (Earth and Water)
entries: You combine earth and water to create a protective ooze for you and your allies, along with being able to take the form of an ooze-like creature. You are now Amorphous and are able to move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

In addition, while in your Elemental Flow State, all allies within 30 feet are covered in a protective ooze, granting them a number of temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier at the start of your turn. Any enemy creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes an amount of acid damage equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die, and any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Water
entries: You can call upon the water in the air to cause a temporary hurricane. You are always under the effect of the Freedom of Movement spell. While in your Elemental Flow State, a storm appears around you in a 20 foot radius, giving healing rain to your allies and pelting your enemies. While in this radius, your enemies have difficult terrain. At the start of your turn, roll your Martial Arts die, your allies gain that many hit points and your enemies take that amount in cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Primal
entries: A monk who follows the Way of the Primal understands that they, as a humanoid, are the top of the food chain. Though even in the strength of being human, there are many things to learn by understanding the beasts around their environment, and taking from their techniques to improve their own. Whether taking inspiration from a falcon who dives on their opponents and flies them away, a panther who pounces on their prey and holds them beneath their claw, or a sea serpent who coils around their hunt, each one has unique lessons to give in the manner of effective combat.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Meditation
entries: You have aligned yourself with the ways of the natural world and the ways of beasts, allowing yourself to become one with their ways. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill animal handling}, {@skill nature}, or {@skill survival}.

In addition, you gain the ability to cast the spell {@spell speak with animals}, but only as a ritual. While under the effects of speak with animals, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against beasts.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator Style
entries: When you take this subclass, you get to chose an Apex Predator Style, either aerial, terrestrial, or aquatic. This style should represent a specific creature you’ve had close interactions with or have studied thoroughly. For example, if you have spent much or your time around wolves, you would have most likely picked up on their terrestrial fighting style, and have implemented it into your personal way of fighting. You can change your apex fighting style whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Aerial
entries: Whenever you land on top of a creature, you can use your Dexterity (Acrobatics) instead of your Strength (Athletics) to attempt to grapple them.
In addition, whenever you have a creature grappled that you are capable of pushing, you can move around with no penalty to your movement.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic
entries: Whenever you are underwater, you can use your Dexterity (Acrobatics) instead of your Strength (Athletics) to attempt to grapple them.
In addition, you gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed and your Constitution modifier represents how many hours you can hold your breath underwater, instead of minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Terrestrial
entries: Whenever you move at least 30 feet directly towards an enemy, you can use your Dexterity (Acrobatics) instead of your Strength (Athletics) to attempt to grapple them.
In addition, whenever you deal damage with an unarmed strike against a creature you have grappled, you deal an extra amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Beastial Body
entries: Your apex predator style grants you new ways to use your body to help you in combat, granting you new abilities whenever you use your Step of the Wind feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aerial
entries: You can summon wings of an appearance of your chosing until the end of your turn. While you have these wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic
entries: You create currents in the water around you by spinning your body around. Any creature submerged in water within 5 feet of you as you travel must make a Strength saving throw against your Ki save DC or be pulled along with you, ending up in a trail following the path you made.

subclassFeature.name: Terrestrial
entries: You take on the power of a large beast and stomp around the battlefield. Your size increases by one category, and anyone who is on the ground and within 5 feet of you as you travel must make a save against your Ki save DC or be knocked prone until the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Hold
entries: Whenever you use Dexterity (Acrobatics) to grapple someone, you can use 1 Ki to instead restrain them.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: Your apex predator style grants you new ways to use your body to help you in combat, granting you new abilities whenever you use your Step of the Wind feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aerial
entries: If someone leaves your attack range through forced movement, you can expend 1 to 3 ki poinst and take a melee attack for each ki point spent.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic
entries: You have gained extreme control over your body while underwater. While having someone restrained through your Primal Hold ability, you can tighten your hold around them, increasing your damage by another roll of your martial arts die and forcing all the air out of their lungs, causing suffocation if they cannot breathe water.

subclassFeature.name: Terrestrial
entries: Your technique to pounce on someone and pin them is beyond any beast. When you lose a grappling contest while using your apex predator style, you can expend a number of Ki points up to your proficiency bonus and roll the same number of your martial arts dice, adding that number to your check. If you use any Ki through this feature, the target is immediately knocked prone.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Arborist
entries: The Oath of the Arborist represents a covenant between these patient knights and the spirits of the forests, embracing the enduring strength and steadfast resolve of the natural world. These paladins are guardians for the woodlands, attuned to the trees and ancient ents. Patient and vigilant, they stand as stalwart protectors of their homelands, defending the sanctity of nature and the creatures that dwell within it.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Arborist
entries: The tenets of the Oath of the Arborist have stand like an ancient tree. This oath emphasizes personal growth and protecting the creatures and ideals within your reach.

subclassFeature.name: Nurture Growth
entries: Through your actions and words, nurture the growth of life and vitality in the natural world. Cultivate forests, groves, and relationships.

subclassFeature.name: Respect Who Came Before
entries: Wisdom takes time to foster, trees and those old enough to grow up with them hold boundless, timeless knowledge. Seek guidance of those who are as wise as a tree.

subclassFeature.name: Embrace Serenity
entries: Find solace and inspiration in the tranquility of nature. Clearer minds find themselves with people who meditate among the whisper of the leaves. Nuture your inner peace.

subclassFeature.name: Everything has a Place
entries: Like nature, everything has its place. From the smallest blade of grass to the largest tree or biggest beast, they have their place in the world. Help those lost find their place and defend against those that upset the ebb and flow.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Entwining Roots
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to request the aid of the timeless nature surrounding you. As an action, you can pick any amount of creatures within 20 feet of you. Those creatures have difficult terrain while walking within that radius and must must make a Dexterity saving throw against the roots coiling up their legs. If they fail, they are grappled. This effects lasts 1 minute, or until they succeed.

At the end of their turns, they can make a Strength saving throw to try to pry themselves out of the vines constricting around them, if they fail this check, they are now restrained and prone as the roots climb their body and pull them to the ground.

subclassFeature.name: Invoke Serenity
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to force your bond with nature onto someone not as willing. As a reaction to when a hostile action is being taken towards you or your ally within 30 feet of you by another creature. When you do, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, if they fail, the calmness of nature floods their mind making them indifferent towards creatures of your choice that it is hostile towards for the next minute.
If the target is attacked or harmed or witnesses any of its friends being harmed, it fails. If a creature is immune to charmed, this has no effect.

subclassFeature.name: Arboreal Aura
entries: You radiate the patience and wisdom of the trees while you aren’t incapacitated. When you and any other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you roll initiative, they can choose to either raise or lower their initiative score by your Charisma modifier.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30ft.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Arbor
entries: The plants around you actively aid your travels. You have the {@spell barkskin} spell always prepared.

In addition, You can enact an 8 hour ritual by placing a set of armor on the ground near any plants. At the end of the ritual, the armor becomes ancient primal magic that hovers around you. You always have an augmented barkskin spell on you, where the armor class, instead of 16, is the armor class of the armor, and it keeps any magical effects. You can also cast this augmented version of barkskin. Once you cast it in this way, you cannot do it again until after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Woodland Champion
entries: You can assume the form of an ancient treant, taking on an appearance you choose. Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You become one size category larger, as well as gaining 5 feet of reach.
In a 15 feet radius around you, vines and roots writhe, trying to grasp at your enemies feet. Creatures of your choice are under the effects of difficult terrain
Nature heals you and blocks attacks. At the start of your turn, roll a {@dice 1d6} + half your Paladin level. Gain that much in HP and Temporary HP.

subclassFeature.name: Storm-Wracked Warden
entries: You embody the tempestuous essence of Shurrock, a land torn by terrible storms. You have learned to walk these dangerous lands and capricious weather. Guided by the teachings of air sentinels, noble beings dedicated to protecting travellers, you have become a master of survival in the face of nature’s fury.

subclassFeature.name: Air Sentinel
entries: Your attacks have the strength of a storm behind them. Once on each of your turns, you can cause this elemental power to manifest in one of the following ways, immediately after you hit a creature with an attack:

items: The attack’s target takes {@dice 1d8} additional thunder damage as a shockwave travels with your attack.
Any enemy creature and loose objects within 5ft of you must succeed a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved 10 feet away from you as a thunderous power forces them away.
You are thrown safely 10ft away from your target as you send the storm towards yourself. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Storm-Wracked Magic
entries: You learn the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip if you don’t already know it. When you cast it, you know exactly when the next storm will be.

You also learn additional spells of 1st level or higher when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Storm-Wracked Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of the Weathered Storm
entries: Your experience travelling in dangerous storms has trained you. You have resistance to thunder and lightning damage.

In addition, due to your experience hunting and surviving in dangerous weathers, you ignore the effects of Lightly Obscured and instead gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks when in Lightly Obscured areas and storms.

subclassFeature.name: Stormwalker's Grace
entries: The wind carries your step, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet. This effect doubles in storms. In addition, the wind can carry you to new heights.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn or if you are knocked unconscious. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (Minimum of once). You gain all uses of this feature at the end of a long rest or if you short rest while exposed to a storm.

subclassFeature.name: Eye of the Hurricane
entries: The winds you fight with permanently surround you. You are permanently under the effects of the {@spell blur} spell. This does not require concentration, and it lasts until you take damage from an attack, to which you can gain it back after the completion of a short or long rest.
In addition, your Air Sentinel feature is not restricted by once on your turns, and your feature grows stronger, changing in the following ways:

items: The damage is increased to {@dice 2d8} additional thunder damage.
Any enemies and creatures are thrown back 20 feet away from you.
You can be thrown safely 20ft away from your target in a direction of your choosing.

subclassFeature.name: Woodland Stalker
entries: Embody the essence of nature’s cunning and stealth, seamlessly blending into dense foliage and shadowed groves of the wilderness. Masters of both primal trickery and the secrets of the natural world, they move with the silence of the wind and the grace of the forest’s creatures. Harnessing the power of nature, they weave spells that manipulate the very elements around them, summoning vines to entangle foes or conjuring mists to shroud their movements.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast spells.

entries.subclassFeature: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher|Rogue||Woodland Stalker|BlairsBundleofBuffs|3

subclassFeature.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three cantrips: {@spell shillelagh} and two other cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. You learn another druid cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Woodland Stalker Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter druid spells|spells|class=druid} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell charm person} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can {@spell charm person} using either slot.

subclassFeature.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level druid spells of your choice. The Spells Known column of the Woodland Stalker Spellcasting table shows when you learn more druid spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the druid spells you know with another spell of your choice from the druid spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your druid spells, since you learn your spells through meditation in nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a druid spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Dextrous Caster
entries: You can cast {@spell shillelagh} as a bonus action, in addition, the weapon also counts as having the Finesse property.

subclassFeature.name: Veiled in Nature
entries: If you take the hide action while attempting to hide in foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena, you gain advantage to Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
In addition, while hiding in this way, you can change your sneak attack damage to match the natural phenomena (Cold for snow, poison for folliage, etc).

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Animal's Guidance
entries: Bolstered by the animals that prowled your home, their lessons bolster your Cunning Action. When performing your Cunning Action, you can also chose one of these effects:

items: Guided by the Rabbit, Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you can add your Dexerity score to any long jump or high jump, but you cannot exeed your movement speed. This effect ends at the end of your turn.

Guided by the Unicorn, You ignore all difficult terrain and if you moved at least 20 feet straight toward a target and hit them with your weapon attack, it must succeed a Strength Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC or be knocked prone.
Guided by the Fox, You gain a burrow speed of 10 feet, allowing you to dig through loose soil. In addition, if you hide in a hole dug by you, you get the effects of your Veiled in Nature feature.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit's Protection
entries: The nature spirits that guide you will protect you when you are the most defenseless. If you are reduced to 0 hit points or are incapacitated against your will, you can immediately gain the benefits of {@spell conjure animals} as if it were cast using a 4th-level slot. It summons one beast of your choice. The beast will appear within 30 feet of you. If they receive no commands from you, they protect you from harm and attack your foes. The spell lasts for 1 hour, requiring no concentration, or until you dismiss it (No action needed).
When Conjure Animals is casted this way, the one beast that appears can gain the effects of your Sneak Attack, their unarmed strikes counting as finesse weapons for it.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bytopian Soul
entries: You or someone from your lineage has been exposed to the intense dual nature of Bytopia, causing your soul to form two halves. Your soul now mirrors the dichotomy of the plane of Bytopia, one half resonating with the orderly prosperity of Dothion while the other in tune with the chaotic storms and rugged landscapes. Your soul is in tune with both, sitting in the middle on the glowing plane, physically shifting whenever you channel one or the other.

subclassFeature.name: Bytopian Attunement
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Bytopian Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can shift your soul to either Dothion or Shurrock. While in the chosen layer, you can cast one 1st-level spell of the associated phase in the Bytopian Spells table once without expending a spell slot. Once you cast a spell in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Binary Proficiency
entries: With your soul having two sides, it empowers your ability to do target two things. You learn the {@spell bifocal blast|BlairsBundleofBuffs} spell, which doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer cantrips you know. This spell, instead of doing d4s for damage, instead does d6s.

subclassFeature.name: Bytopian Boons
entries: The current layer your attuned with can effect your Metamagic feature. Both of the layers are associated with certain Metamagic options, as shown here:

If have access to these Metamagic options, when using them, you can reduce the sorcery points spent by 1 (minumum 0). If you do not have access to any of these Metamagic options, you can still use them by instead increasing the sorcery points spent by 1. Whether reducing or increaseing, you can only use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dothion
entries: Careful Spell, Subtle Spell, Twinned Spell

subclassFeature.name: Shurrock
entries: Empowered Spell, Heightened Spell, Twinned Spell

subclassFeature.name: Cross the Boundary
entries: You gain a better control over your soul. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change your soul to turn, swapping to the other layer.
When you do so, your next spell is empowered. If the spell is able to be Twinned spelled, you can do so for free. Once you use this feature to do so, you cannot do so again until after a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Planar Embodiment
entries: The bisected world encompasses your soul and body. While you are attuned to a layer, you also gain the following benefit associated with that phase:

subclassFeature.name: Dothion
entries: You radiate an aura of calmness and friendlyness. You and creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Deception) checks on other sentient creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Shurrock
entries: Your soul has weathered storms enough to sweep most people off their feet. You are resistant to Lightning and Thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bytopian Equilibrium
entries: As a bonus action, you can find the equilibrium between the two layers and align it to your soul. You gain a flying speed of 60ft and can hover as a translucent layer of daylight bisects your body horizontally. making you radiate 30ft of bright light and another 30ft of dim.

In addition, any instance that requires you to be attuned to a layer, you count as being in both layers during this time. This lasts for 1 minute and cannot be used again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Adamantine Dragon
entries: Your patron is one of the strongest dragons mortals can interact with. Their makes ancient red dragons seem like wyrmlings in comparisons. Though, they are luckily dedicated to good. As self-titled protectors of Bytopia, adamantine dragons constantly scower the lands for any danger to their lands or inhabitants in trouble. Only one adamantine dragon is known by name in the realm, and that’s Mercialla. If misfortune falls upon Bytopia, she’s the one who heeds the call.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: When casting {@spell eldritch blast} you can change the damage type to Fire or Radiaint.
In addition, The Adamantine Dragon lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Adamantine Dragon Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell summon draconic spirit|FTD}, {@spell circle of power}

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Prodigy
entries: You acquire the training necessary to fight like an adamantine dragon, an impenetrable wall. You gain proficiency with medium armor, heavy armor, and shields.

subclassFeature.name: Evervigilant Protector
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Perception}. If you were already proficient, you gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.
In addition, while unconscious, you do not have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Endurance
entries: You gain either the {@optfeature Interception|TCE} or {@optfeature Protection} fighting style. Whenever you use your reaction to use either of these fighting styles, gain temporary HP equal to your Charisma modifier + half your warlock level.

subclassFeature.name: Pausing Breath
entries: Your patron has trusted you with a fragment of their ability to stop time. As an action, you can exhale a 120ft cone of time-stopping gas. Everyone in that cone must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be frozen in time for {@dice 1d4+1} turns. You must concentrate on this effect.
This ends early if you interact with the creatures effected in any way. Once this ability has been used, you cannot use it again until after a week has past.

subclassFeature.name: Adamantine Blessing
entries: Your patron has gifted you the strength of adamantine itself. As a bonus action, you can manifest their power. You gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain truesight with a range of 30ft.
You can use the Interception or Protection fighting styles without using a reaction.
Whenever you take damage, reduce the damage taken by half your warlock level.
Whenever you attack an object, that attack is always a critical hit.

entries: Once you use this bonus action, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Astral Gates
entries: The School of Astral Gates delves into the mysteries of the astral plane, mastering the art of creating portals that transcend the boundaries of reality itself. Wizards of this school use the choatic, boundless nature of the Astral Plane to create portals, ephemeral bridges between space, linking deliberate spaces in the fabric of existance.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Gates
entries: Through your study of the Astral Plane, you have learned to harness its magic to create portals that briefly travel through it to connect to another space nearby. Your access to this magic is represented by a number of Astral Threads, which are equal to your Intelligence Modifier + 2 * Your Wizard Level. You gain these Astral Threads back during a long rest.

As an action, you can expend any amount of Astral Threads to place one side of the portal in an unoccupied space within a range equal to the amount of Astral Threads expended * 5 feet that you can see. The other side of the portal is placed within 5 feet of you in an unoccupied space.
To use this portal, anyone can use 5ft of their movement to enter either portal and come out of the other one. The portal lasts until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Plane Familiarization
entries: Your familiarity and study into the astral sea has lead to you using it to benefit your movement. You gain a 10ft walking speed and can add your Intelligence Modifier to your jumping distance, as the subjective gravity of the Astral Plane lingers on you.
In addition, when travelling through the Astral Plane, your movement speed is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Winds
entries: You’re able to open a small, one way Astral Gate that connects directly to the Astral Sea, letting in a burst of Psychic Winds to muddle the minds of people nearby.

As an action, you can place an Astral Gate within 30ft of you by expending 3 Astral Threads. When you do, every creature within 10ft of it must make an Intelligence Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC at the start of their turn, or roll on the Psychic Winds table to determine the magical effect produced. This portal cannot be traveled through and closes immediately after.

entries.caption: Psychic Winds Table
rows: Pushed 30ft into the air, taking {@dice 3d6} of falling damage
Disadvantage on Attack Rolls for 1 minute

entries: For any lasting effects, the creature can reroll their saving throw at the end of their turn.

In addition, you can use your Astral Threads to lean rolls on the Psychic Winds table into your favor, reducing or adding the number rolled by the amount of Astral Threads expended. You can use a maximum of Astral Threads equal to your proficiency bonus and can only be done once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lasting Connections
entries: Your portals can last longer as long as you maintain focus on them. After using your Astral Gate or your Psychic Winds, if you use your bonus action and one Astral Thread on consecutive turns to keep the portal open.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Portals
entries: As a reaction, when being hit with a ranged attack, you can place a portal in front of incoming projectile. Expend an amount of Astral Threads up to your Proficiency Bonus and roll an amount of d6s equal to the amount spent. If this reduces the damage to 0, as part of the same reaction, you can make a ranged spell attack against the creature attacking you. If you hit, they take damage equal to the amount meant to hit you as the portal engulfs the entire projectile.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Plane Mastery
entries: You have mastered the magic of the Astral Sea, along with its timeless nature. You now age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

In addition, you can use this energy to speed up the casting of your spells. By using a reaction, you can expend an amount of Astral Threads equal to 5 * the level of the spell to ignore the casting time and instead cast it instantly.

feat.name: Actor (Revised)
entries: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit}.
You have advantage on Charisma (Deception) or Charisma (Performance) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

You can create a diversion by making either a Charisma (Deception) check or a Charisma (Performance) check. If you do so, choose a number of targets equal to half your level that can see or hear you. Each target must make a contested Wisdom (Insight) check. If you succeed, a target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Peception) checks and initiative rolls for the duration of your diversion and for 1 minute after a target can no longer see or hear you.

feat.name: Athlete (Revised)
entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

items: When you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
Climbing and swimming doesn’t cost you extra movement.
You can make a running long jump or a running high jump without any previous movement, rather than 10 feet.
Whenever you Ready an action, you can also move up to your speed (minus any movement used during your turn) when the trigger occurs and you use your reaction.

feat.name: Defensive Duelist (Revised)
entries: When you are wielding a finesse weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with an attack that you can see, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack.
If this causes the attack to miss you, you may also make a melee attack with a finesse weapon against that creature as a part of the same reaction if it is within reach.

feat.name: Dungeon Delver (Revised)
entries: Adapted to navgating within widing labyrinths and dark dungeons, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) Checks made to detect the presence of secret doors and hidden pathways.
Climbing and swimming doesn’t cost you extra movement.
You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
You gain advantage on any Wisdom (Survival) checks to navigate manmade areas.

feat.name: Durable (Revised)
entries: Hardy and resilient, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).
You have advantage on Constitution saving throws to avoid gaining points of exhaustion.
You have advantage on death saving throws. If you would ever suffer instant death, you are instead reduced to 0 hit points with one death saving throw failure.

feat.name: Elemental Adept (Revised)
entries: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. In addition, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals damage of that type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Grappler (Revised)
entries: You’ve developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling.

items: You have advantage on melee weapon attacks against a creature you are grappling including attempts to shove or knock it prone.
You learn the following grappling maneuvers:

entries: {@bold Headlock.} As an action you can attempt to suffocate a creature that you are grappling. Make another grappling check contested by the target. On a success the creature is silenced and begins choking (see chapter 8 of the PHB, “The Environment” for rules on suffocation). You must use your action each turn to maintain the grapple this way, inflicting 1d6 bludgeoning damage to the target each time you do so.

{@bold Pin Down.} As an action you can attempt to restrain a creature you are grappling. Make another grappling check contested by the target. On a success the target is Restrained, and your movement is reduced to 0 for the duration of the grapple.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master (Revised)
entries: You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.
While you are wearing heavy armor, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical weapons is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Keen Mind (Revised)
