entries: You have a mind that can track and discern detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month and have advantage on intelligence checks to remember or discern such details.
You have advantage on saving throws against illusion spells as well as any intelligence checks to disbelieve an illusion.

Choose one skill to gain proficiency from: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature} or {@skill Religion}. If you are already proficient in the chosen skill, you can double your proficiency bonus for that skill.

feat.name: Linguist (Revised)
entries: You have studied languages and codes extensively, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn three languages of your choice.

You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to understand the basic meaning of anything vocally communicated by a creature that you can hear or anything physically communicated by a creature you can see, provided that you have spent at least 1 minute observing it.

You can able create written ciphers. Others can’t decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

You have advantage on Intelligence checks to try and decode ciphers. If you can not immediately decode a cipher you can spend a day’s work to gain a basic understanding of what is written, allowing you to re-roll your attempt to decode it.

feat.name: Medium Armor Master (Revised)
entries: You have trained to master the use of medium armor, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with medium armor.
Wearing medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.
When you wear medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

feat.name: Poisoner (Revised)
entries: You can prepare and deliver deadly poisons, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores resistance to poison damage.
You can apply poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a bonus action, instead of an action.

You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|phb} if you don't already have it. With one hour of work using a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} and expending 50 gp worth of materials, you can create a number of doses of potent poison equal to your proficiency bonus. Once applied to a weapon or 10 pieces of ammunition, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you hit with the weapon or ammunition. When a creature takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier) or take {@dice 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Skill Expert (Revised)
entries: You have honed your proficiency with particular skills, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table skills|phb} or {@filter tools|items|type=tools;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set;vehicle (land);vehicle (water)} of your choice.

Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Skulker (Revised)
entries: You are expert at slinking through shadows. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can take the Hide action as a bonus action.
You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight.

feat.name: Spell Sniper (Revised)
entries: You have learned techniques to enhance your attacks with certain kinds of spells, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled.
Your ranged spell attacks ignore {@quickref Cover||3||half cover} and {@quickref Cover||3||three-quarters cover}.

You learn one cantrip that requires an attack roll. Choose the cantrip from the {@filter bard|spells|level=0|class=bard|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0|class=cleric|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0|class=druid|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0|class=sorcerer|spell attack=m;r;o}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0|class=warlock|spell attack=m;r;o}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=wizard|spell attack=m;r;o} spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip depends on the spell list you chose from: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler (Revised)
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised weapons. Your improvised weapons use a 1d6 for damage, or 1d8 if they are wielded with two hands.
Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage d4} for damage.
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

Your improvised weapons can have any of the following properties if the DM deems it appropriate: finesse, heavy, light, reach, two-handed. Anything that weighs less than your carrying capacity and is no more than one size larger than you can be used as an improvised weapon.

feat.name: Weapon Master (Revised)
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with all simple and martial weapons.
Once per turn when you roll damage for a weapon attack, you can re-roll the weapon’s damage dice and use either total.

feat.name: Attunement Adept
entries: Your study of the arcane and magic items have come with some benefits. You can attune to an additional magic item.

feat.name: Predator's Senses
entries: You have a nose like a wolf, gaining the following benefits:

items: You can trace the smell of blood within 50 feet of you. You can also smell invisible or hidden creatures if blood has been drawn.
Once per long rest, while smelling blood, you can use an action to identify a creature’s type.

feat.name: Combat Ready
entries: You are always ready for combat, gaining the following benefits:

items: When you roll Initiative, you gain 10 Temporary hit points and can take a bonus action.
You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score.

feat.name: Fearful Fighter
entries: You fight with the constant fear of pain and death, each act of pain making you jump. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to move 10 feet away from the source. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Your speed increases by 15 feet while you are below half of your maximum hit points.

feat.name: Light Armor Master
entries: You have trained to master using what little armor you have, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with light armor.
While not wearing medium or heavy armor and not wielding a shield, creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you.
You can attempt to break free of a grapple as a bonus action instead of an action.

feat.name: Trap Expert
entries: Quick with your tools and alert to the dangers of traps, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in {@item thieves' tools|phb}
You can use thieves’ tools or the use an object action as a bonus action.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps and you have resistance to damage dealt by traps.

spell.name: Absolution
entries: You create a protective veil around a willing creature you can touch. When the protected creature would take damage, that damage is reduced by {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This damage reduction can only happen once per turn.

components.m: a small emblem of a shield

spell.name: Acid Rain
entries: Acid rain begins falling within a 30-foot-radius 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. When a creature moves into the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d4} acid damage, and becomes covered in acid. A creature covered in acid takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage at the end of their turn for each time they have failed a saving throw against this spell.
A creature can spend an action to wipe off the acid, clearing all stacks of acid damage.

components.m: a drop of water and sulfur

spell.name: Alicorn Lance
entries: You summon a spectral alicorn’s horn and launch it at a creature within range. Roll a ranged spell attack, if you hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Arc Pulse
entries: An arc of sustained, violent lightning forms between two creatures that you can see within range. For the duration, each target takes {@damage 4d12} lightning damage at the end of each of its turns. The spell ends if one of the targets ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the other target.

components.m: a magnet that has been struck by lightning

spell.name: Arcane Push
entries: You send out a blast of energy toward a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} force damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you push the creature 5 feet away from you.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Arctic Breath
entries: A line of freezing arctic wind 30 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and their movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t slowed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Banner of Freedom
entries: You stake a spectral banner in the ground at your feet with a symbol of your choice on it. No one can touch or interact with this banner besides you, which you can use your object interact to pick up and hold using one hand.

For the duration, as long as you stay within 30 feet of the banner, each friendly creature within 30 feet of the banner has their speed increased by 10 feet until the end of their turn and can take the disengage action as a bonus action this turn.
You can only have 1 banner spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a banner spell is active, the new banner replaces the old one.

spell.name: Banner of the Gods
entries: You stake a spectral banner in the ground at your feet with a symbol of your choice on it. No one can touch or interact with this banner besides you, which you can use your object interact to pick up and hold using one hand.
For the duration, as long as you stay within 30 feet of the banner, all auras created by you have their radius increased by 20 feet.
You can only have 1 banner spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a banner spell is active, the new banner replaces the old one.

spell.name: Banner of Justice
entries: You stake a spectral banner in the ground at your feet with a symbol of your choice on it. No one can touch or interact with this banner besides you, which you can use your object interact to pick up and hold using one hand.

For the duration, as long as you stay within 30 feet of the banner, each friendly creature within 30 feet of the banner gains advantage on any checks or saving throws against getting {@condition frightened}. In addition, all attacks made within the range of the banner against a target within the banner gains an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.
You can only have 1 banner spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a banner spell is active, the new banner replaces the old one.

spell.name: Banner of Sanctuary
entries: You stake a spectral banner in the ground at your feet with a symbol of your choice on it. No one can touch or interact with this banner besides you, which you can use your object interact to pick up and hold using one hand.

For the duration, as long as you stay within 30 feet of the banner, each friendly creature within 30 feet of the banner gains {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting modifier in Temporary Hit Points. In addition, if any attacks are made towards unarmed noncombatants under the effect of your banner, the attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC or be forced to pick a different target.
You can only have 1 banner spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a banner spell is active, the new banner replaces the old one.

spell.name: Banner of War
entries: You stake a spectral banner in the ground at your feet with a symbol of your choice on it. No one can touch or interact with this banner besides you, which you can use your object interact to pick up and hold using one hand. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following:
Arrow. Friendly creatures affected by the banner gain +2 to all the damage rolls of their ranged attacks.
Sword. Friendly creatures affected by the banner gain +2 to all the damage rolls of their melee attacks
Shield. Friendly creatures affected by the banner gain +1 to their AC.

For the duration, as long as you stay within 30 feet of the banner, each friendly creature within 30 feet of the banner gains the chosen benefit as long as they stay within 30 feet and can see the banner.
You can only have 1 banner spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a banner spell is active, the new banner replaces the old one.

spell.name: Binding Oath
entries: You bind a creature’s soul to an oath it speaks. A willing creature you remain touching while you are casting this spell may speak an oath in a language you understand. The oath must begin with the phrase “I swear…”.

While under this oath, if the target breaks their oath, they gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. You feel it if the oath is broken, and can also sense the direction of the creature when they break it.

When the creature under oath breaks it to gain a 6th point of {@condition exhaustion}, they can choose for the spell to end, not gaining the point of {@condition exhaustion}. The caster knows if the spell ends in this way.

components.m: a silver knot worth at least 50gp

spell.name: Blade Leap
entries: You launch a bladed weapon towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack roll, if you hit, deal the damage and effects that weapon would do on hit.

components.m: a melee weapon that does piercing or slashing damage

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher, you can launch an additional weapon for every three slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Blazing Tendrils
entries: Writhing tendrils of white hot fire fill a 30-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} bludgeoning and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tentacles takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) agains tyour spell save DC. On a success. it frees itself.

components.m: a bit of tinder and a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus

spell.name: Bloodbriars
entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hidden spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@dice 4d4} piercing for every 5 feet it travels.

The briars are {@condition invisible} to the naked eye. If a creature uses its action to examine the area, the creature can determine the radius of the spell with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) or Intelligence (Nature) check against your spell save DC. Plant creatures instantly succeed this check.

components.m: a sharp thorn coated in dried blood

spell.name: Breach
entries: A sudden vibration attempts to tear appart the world around a point of your choice within range. Every creature within a 30-foot radius of that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d10} thunder damage if they fail, or half as much on a success. Creatures made of organic materials have resistance to this damage.

components.m: a shard of brick or stone

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bird of Prey
entries: You extend out your arms as wings sprout from your back, gaining birdlike traits. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You gain a flying speed equal to 40 feet
You gain talons that sprout from your hands and feet that you can use to make unarmed strikes. You are proficient with this attack and they deal {@damage 2d4} piercing damage.
You gain advantage with any checks that rely on sight or smell.

components.m: four feathers from different birds

spell.name: Bifocal Blast
entries: You send out a dual sided blast at two different creatures or objects within range. Make one ranged spell attack against the targets. On a hit, the targets takes {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Bow to the Divine
entries: You say a prayer to your god, striking fear into your enemies. All creatures within 15 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and are forced to grovel, making them {@condition prone}. If they succeed, they take half damage and are not {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Burning Blood
entries: The blood of a creature you can see within range starts to boil and burn. Choose a creature to make a Constitution saving throw, they have advantage on this roll if they are not currently bleeding. If they fail, all attack rolls against the creature gets an additional {@damage 2d6} acid damage as their burning blood leaves burns as it drips down their body.
Creatures who cannot bleed, such as constructs or undead, cannot be effected by this spell.

components.m: a pinch of saltpeter and a drop of blood

spell.name: Calliope's Gale Blast
entries: With magic to enhance your wings, you create a large force of wind to push everyone around you away. Each creature within the radius must make a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} slashing damage and be pushed 15 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell’s effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Calliope's Slashing Gust
entries: You slash your hands through the air, channeling miniature ripples of air from each finger to slice your enemy. If you have two hands free, you can target two creatures within range with this spell; otherwise, you target one.
Make a ranged attack roll at at each creature you target. On a hit, they take {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Cube Hop
entries: While in Acheron, this spell instantly transports you and up to six willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to the closest side of a cube you can see. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 10-foot cube, and it can’t be held or carried by an unwilling creature.
The spell fizzles and causes your skin to take on a metallic hue for 24 hours if cast on a plane other than Acheron.

spell.name: Cutting Hand
entries: You change the hand of a willing creature to act as a bladed weapon. While under the effect of this spell, the target can use their hands to make an unarmed strike that deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

spell.name: Delicious Weakness

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 30 feet of you fail a saving throw

entries: You strike on a moment of weakness to read into a creature’s soul and uncover their weakness. Whenever you cast this spell, you learn one of the following:

items: All of their damage vulnerabilities
All of their damage resistances
All of their damage immunities
All of their condition immunities.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, you can choose an additional option for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Diabolic Grasp
entries: You launch a writhing mass of tentacles towards a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and if the target is size large or smaller, they are dragged up to 30 feet closer to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Echo Chamber
entries: You choose a point within range and cause a transparent sphere to form which sound can’t escape and create an ear shattering echo inside. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. After they fail, they are also {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
No matter if the target failed or succeeded, the force of the echoes push them into a new position. You can push any creature to move 30 feet in a direction of your choosing within the radius.

components.m: a tiny silver bell

spell.name: Edge of Arumdina
entries: Named after Garl Glittergold’s sentient battleaxe, this spell, whenever you touch a weapon, gives you similiar traits. When you cast this spell, touch a weapon, and during the time of the spell, that weapon can pass through metal, stone, or earth as if they aren’t there and the weapon gains 5 feet of reach.
In addition, if the target being attacked is wearing armor made out of metal, stone, or earth, the attacks are being made at advantage.

spell.name: Elixir of Anguish
entries: You infuse two potions, infusing the essence of contentness into one and anguish into the other. As part of creating this elixir, you drink a potion and throw the other. For the duration of the spell, your speed is doubled and you can take the dash action as a bonus action.

You also throw the potion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of where it shatters must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they must choose between taking their movement or their action and bonus action. They can reroll this saving throw at the end of their turns.

You can only have 1 elixir spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another elixir while under the effects of another, take damage equal to an amount of d6s equal to double the spell level of the elixir in poison. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

spell.name: Elixir of Bliss
entries: You infuse two potions, infusing the essence of bliss into one and curse into the other. As part of creating this elixir, you drink a potion and throw the other. When you drink this potion, you cure up to 4 conditions from yourself, caused by good or bad effects. If the conditions stem from spells that are 5th level or higher, roll a check with your ability spellcasting modifier with a DC of 10 + the spell’s level for each condition. If you succeed, you cure that condition. For each condition cured this way, gain 10 Temporary Hit Points. You lose the Temporary Hit Points after the spell ends.

You also throw the potion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of where it shatters must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they are under the effect of the spell Slow.

You can only have 1 elixir spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another elixir while under the effects of another, take damage equal to an amount of d6s equal to double the spell level of the elixir in poison. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

spell.name: Elixir of Ignorance
entries: You infuse two potions, infusing the essence of ignorance into both. As part of creating this elixir, you drink a potion and throw the other. When you drink this potion, you have advantage on any saving throws or ability checks that would hinder your movement.

You also throw the potion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of where it shatters must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they are {@condition blinded} for the duration of the spell. They can reroll their saving throws at the end of their turns.

You can only have 1 elixir spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another elixir while under the effects of another, take damage equal to an amount of d6s equal to double the spell level of the elixir in poison. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

spell.name: Elixir of Promise
entries: You infuse two potions, one with good health and the other with poison. As part of creating this elixir, you drink the potion and throw the other. At the start of your turn, you heal a number of Hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

You also throw the potion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of where it shatters must make a Constitution saving throw or be Poisoned for the condition. They can reroll this saving throw at the end of their turns.

You can only have 1 elixir spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another elixir while under the effects of another, take damage equal to an amount of d6s equal to double the spell level of the elixir in poison. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

spell.name: Elixir of Risk
entries: You infuse two potions with the magical essence of risk. As part of creating this elixir, you drink the potion and throw the other. For the duration of this spell, damage coming from weapon attack rolls and spell attack rolls are doubled. Spell attack rolls from spells equal to or from higher levels of Elixir of Risk do not gain this benefit.

You also throw the potion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of where it shatters must make a Constitution saving throw or their attacks become weaker. For the duration of this spell, damage coming from weapon attack rolls and spell attack rolls are halved. Spell attack rolls from spells equal to or from higher levels of Elixir of Risk are not effected. They can reroll this saving throw at the end of their turns.

You can only have 1 elixir spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another elixir while under the effects of another, take damage equal to an amount of d6s equal to double the spell level of the elixir in poison. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

spell.name: Endurance of Ilmater
entries: You gain the power to endure like Ilmater. When you cast this spell, roll {@dice 10d6 + 30} and gain that much Temporary Hit Points. While you have this temporary health, you cannot be forcefully moved or knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Enhancement of Glaciation
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily covered in a thick sheet of ice.

A set of armor under this spell allows the user to use their action to become immune to fire damage until the start of their turn. In addition, the area around the wearer becomes cold enough to cause frostbite. in a radius around 15 feet of the user, the area is difficult terrain and if anyone ends their turn there, they take {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

A weapon under the effect of this spell deals an additional {@damage 3d6} cold damage on hit. In addition, on the first attack that hits, the ice coating the weapon shatters and deals {@damage 1d6} damage to any creatures within 5ft of the target besides the wielder.

A casting focus under this spell deals an additional {@damage 2d6} cold damage on any spell attack rolls made using it. If a creature is hit by a spell cast through the casting focus, their speed is reduced by 15 feet until the end of their turn.
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Enhancement of Immolation
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily coated in a layer of flames.

A set of armor under this spell allows the user to use their action to become immune to fire damage until the start of their turn. In addition, if they are grappling a creature, that creature takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage at the start of their turn.

A weapon under the effects of this spell cracks and splits, splitting into different shards connected by large weaving threads of flame. The weapon gains 10 feet of reach and deals an additional {@damage 2d6} fire damage.

A casting focus under this spell deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage on any spell attack rolls made using it. If a creature is hit by a spell cast through the casting focus, they must make a Dexterity saving throw or bit lit on fire, taking {@damage 1d10} fire damage at the start of their turn. Someone can take an action to put out the fire.
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Enhancement of Lightning
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily charged with lightning, crackling across its surface.

A set of armor under this spell grants the user a reaction whenever it takes damage. When it takes this reaction, the attacker takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. If the attacker is wearing metal armor, it is increased to {@dice 2d6}.

A weapon or casting focus under the effects of this spell gain an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on attacks using them. In addition, they both gain an action to create a 60 foot long, 5 foot wide bolt of lightning. All creatures in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage. After this action is taken, the spell ends.
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Enhancement of Perception
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily granted the ability to aid in your senses and sense the area around you.
A set of armor under the effects of this spell grants the useradvantage on initiative rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks, emblazoning the front of it with the symbol of an eye.
A weapon or casting focus under the effects of this spell grants the wielder advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any companions within 30 feet of you cannot be {@status surprised}.
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Enhancement of Slaying
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily granted the ability to cut down specific creatures. As part of casting this spell, chose a creature type.

A set of armor under the effects of this spell protects the creature wearing it from those types of creatures. If the wearer of the armor takes damage from a creature of the said type, they reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier.

A weapon or a casting focus under the effects of this spell deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage if the attack hits a creature of the said type. The damage can match any damage type that’s already apart of the attack.
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Enhancement of Stealth
entries: You touch a set of armor, a weapon, or a casting focus. The item is temporarily turned into an object or outfit of your chosing. A set of armor could be turned into clothes, a weapon could be turned into a walking stick, or a casting focus could be turned into jewelry. While in this form, the item counts as a mundane item with 1 hit point and 10 AC, the spell ending if it is destroyed.
In addition, the wielder of the transformed item can use a bonus action on their turn to end the spell.
This spell’s targets increase by 1 when you reach 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).
You can only have 1 enhancement spell active without issue at any given time. If you create another enhancement while under the effects of another, the spell fails.

spell.name: Eldritch Aura
entries: You emit a crackling energy, surrounding yourself in a 5-foot radius around you. All hostile creatures within the aura must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage.
Eldritch Aura also gains the effect of anything that interacts with Eldritch Blast and counts as Eldritch Blast for prerequisites.
The spell’s damage and radius increase by {@dice 1d8} and 5 feet when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} and 10 feet), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} and 15 feet), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} and 20 feet).

spell.name: Eldritch Edge
entries: You can invoke your patron’s power to coat your blade in crackling energy or summon a weapon made of that energy.

If you summon a weapon using this cantrip, it lasts for 1 minute and has the finesse and light traits. If you drop the weapon, the spell ends. It deals {@damage 1d10} force damage on hit. You can attack with the weapon as part of conjuring it.

If you empower a blade using this spell, as part of the spell’s casting you can make a melee attack with it against one creature within the weapon’s reach. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects, and takes an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage.
Eldritch Edge also gains the effect of anything that interacts with Eldritch Blast and counts as Eldritch Blast for prerequisites.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Elemental Spiders
entries: You summon a swarm of elementally infused spiders to appear in a 20 foot cube within range. When you cast this spell, choose a damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Anyone who ends their turn within the swarm must make a Constitution save. On a fail, they take {@dice 4d10} of the damage taken or half as much on a success.
As a bonus action, you can move the swarm up to 30 feet. If you move the swarm to attack a target, they surround them and they must make a Constitution saving throw against the swarm’s damage.

m.text: A golden ring with a gem worth at least 300gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Fantastic Machine
entries: You call forth a construct to aid you in battle. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Fantastic Machine|blairsbundleofbuffs} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a form: Golem, Seige Weapon, or Vehicle. The creature resembles a construct of your choice marked by the chosen form, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

m.text: a pile of gadgets and gizmos worth at least 300gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Fissure
entries: You rend the earth asunder, opening a 60-foot-long 5-feet-wide crevice. Creatures on the ground in that area must make a dexterity save. On a failure, a creature falls into the opened crevice before it snaps shut, crushing them. creatures take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage from the fall and crush.

The creature is buried in 15 feet of rubble. Creatures without a borrowing speed require 30 feet of movement to extract themselves from the loose rubble to return to where they failed the saving throw. If they end their turn while buried, they take an additional {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage.

components.m: a pinch of dirt, a a piece of rock, and a lump of clay

spell.name: Gem Bomb
entries: You enchant a number of gems with explosive energy that you keep at the ready during the duration of the spell. When you cast the spell— and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter— you can expend one of these enchanted gems, tossing them at a point you choose within 90ft of you. Once a gem reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, the magic inside the gems explode out. Each creature within 10 feet of the point where the gem explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. Divide the cost of the gem by 10gp, each creature effected will take that amount of d6s in force damage on a fail, or half as much on a success.
You can only enchant gems with a cost equal to 10gp times your proficiency modifier

m.text: a number of gems that have a total gp worth of 200gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the cost for the material goes up by 60gp.

spell.name: Hail of Stone
entries: You summon rocks to rain around a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. The ground within the radius is also difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5 foot square requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

components.m: a chip of jade

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Holy Dart
entries: You launch a small projectile of divine energy at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Holy Slash
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell’s casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within reach of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack’s normal effects and then becomes enveloped in glowing radiant energy until the start of your next turn. The target sheds bright light in a 5 foot radius around them and dim light an additional 5 feet until the spell ends. If the enveloped creature targets a creature other than you with an attack or a harmful spell before the spell ends, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage, and the spell ends. This spell doesn’t trigger from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball, as long as you are within the effect’s radius.

At 5th level, the melee attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for attacking someone other than you increases to {@dice 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 3d8}) and again at 17th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 4d8}).

components.m: a melee weapon

spell.name: Martyrdom
entries: This spell protects up to 5 other willing creatures within 30 feet of you and creatures a mystic connection between you and them until the spell ends. While any creature effected by the spell is within 60 feet of you, they gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws, and has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the any creature effected become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on any of the effected creatures. You can also dismiss the spell as an action.

m.text: a set of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which each creature effected must be wearing

spell.name: Mistclaw
entries: You conjure a claw of visible mist, fog, or steam within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, chose a damage type between acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the Mistclaw. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier of the damage type chosen.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the claw up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

components.m: a scale or talon from a draconic creature

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Nightmare Poison
entries: You coat a piece of ammo or weapon in a black ichor. The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during the spell’s duration, its mind is bombarded by imagery of nightmarish creatures, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 5d10} psychic damage. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, or it is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Oak's Stalwart Frost
entries: You pull water from the air and start to freeze it around yourself to create a protective barrier. You gain {@dice 2d8 + 10} temporary hit points for the duration. While under this spells effect, your movement is reduced by 15 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: One with the Land
entries: You become in tune with the land around you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain 60 feet of darkvision, if you already had darkvision instead increase it by 30 feet.
You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, smell, or hearing.
You gain advantage on Intelligence (Nature) and Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

spell.name: Poison Dart
entries: You conjure a dart of pure poison and hurl it a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} poison damage and must pass a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

components.m: a drop of poison

spell.name: Poppy's Builder Toss
entries: You raise a rock from the ground beneath you and launch it at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Poppy's Bountiful Gift
entries: From the earth beneath is where nature stems, and you have learned how to bring out it’s original beauty. As nature grows around you, the plants around protect you harm.
Everyone you choose within the radius gains {@dice 1d4 + 4} temporary hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level about 1st.

spell.name: Radiant Spheres
entries: You create three glowing orbs of light that begin to hover around your head. These orbs shed bright light and then dim light in a radius around you. The radius of each type of light is a number of feet equal to 10 times the number of orbs currently active.

As a bonus action on your turn, you may command one of the orbs to strike at a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see. You roll a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit the creature takes {@damage 1d10} radiant damage. The orb disappears whether or not the attack hits, reducing therefore the radius of each type of light around you by 10 feet. Once all the orbs are gone, the spell ends.

components.m: a rock that glows in the dark

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell level slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain an extra orb for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Reverse Missile

time.condition: which you take when you are damaged by a ranged attack or magic missile

entries: When it looks like a missile, whether mundane like a crossbow bolt or magical like a magic missile, is about to hit you, you can flip it around and force it back at the attacker. Make a ranged spell attack, if you hit, deal the damage the missile would have done.

If the missile is caused by a spell of 3rd level or higher, you must additionally make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell’s level. On a success, the spell works as normal but if you fail, the spell has no effect.

spell.name: Rhino's Rush
entries: You are filled with the rage of a large beast. You move in a straight line towards a creature within a range of double your walking speed. Everyone within 5ft of the path you travel must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.
The creature you are rushing towards must make a Strength save. On a fail, they take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and are pushed back 15 feet.

spell.name: Ring of Protection from Evil and Good
entries: Choose a point within range. Centered on that point, a 15-foot radius sphere protects everyone inside from certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can’t be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by them. If the target is already {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

spell.name: Sacred Symbol
entries: You create a glowing sacred symbol that hovers in the air within range. The glowing symbol occupies a space no larger than a 5 foot cube, and sheds dim light for 20 feet. This sacred symbol can be:

items: Your holy symbol.
A depiction of your god or of a person or object associated with your god.
Your god’s name spelt out in a language you can write.

entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the symbol up to 60 feet to a new spot within range that you can see.

components.m: a silver coin with your god's likeness or symbol on it

spell.name: Salmon Form
entries: You touch a willing creature and turn it into a salmon for the duration of the spell. Use the stats of a {@creature Fish|GOS} to represent the salmon, and follow the rules of Wild Shape for this transformation.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or higher, the targets of this spell increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Seismic Stride
entries: Your steps have the force of an earthquake behind them, sending out shockwaves every footfall. For the duration, your speed is increased by 5 feet.

Whenever you move within 5 feet of a creature or an object that isn’t being worn or carried, they must make a Strength saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 1d4} Thunder damage and are pushed back 5 feet away from you.

spell.name: Snakebite
entries: You launch a venomous snake towards a creature within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, they take {@damage 4d6} poison damage and are {@condition stunned}.
At the end of their turn, they take {@damage 1d6} poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw to break the paralysis.

spell.name: Song of Courage
entries: You play a song that emodies the fight and fills allies with courage. All allies within range gain advantage on any saving throws against being Frightened.
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Song of Discord
entries: You play a song of disjunct melodies, muddling the minds of those around you. Any creatures of your choice within the radius must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, they feel compelled to attack the nearest creature as if it were a dangerous enemy. At the end of their turns, they can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effects.
Creatures who are {@condition deafened} or cannot hear are immune to this spell’s effects.
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Song of Healing
entries: You play a song that weaves magic around you and patches up the wounds of those nearby. Any ally within the radius during the duration can use a bonus action to restore {@dice 1d6} hit points
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Song of Protection
entries: You play a song that keeps your allies on their toes. While within the radius of your song, any ally who sees an attack go towards an ally also within the radius can use their reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack.
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Song of Strength
entries: You play a song that empowers those around you with strength. All allies within the radius gain advantage on ability checks involving Strength and have double their Carrying Capacity for the duration.
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Song of Travel
entries: As you travel while strumming your instrument or humming a song, it empowers the people around you. While under this spell, your travel pace is one step faster (slow becomes normal, normal becomes fast). While under this spell, you cannot move stealthily.
You can only have 1 song spell active at any given time. If you cast a spell while a song spell is active, the new song replaces the old one.

spell.name: Sonic Thrust
entries: A force of sound echoes from your mouth. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.
If a target fails, they are pushed 30 feet away directly away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Status Check
entries: You choose one humanoid or beast that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. You learn any illnesses, poisons, or diseases, if any, are currently effecting it.
If the effects are magical in nature, an Intelligence (Arcana) roll may be required to get a proper understanding beyond a name.

m.text: a moonstone worth at least 100gp and a stork feather

spell.name: Splitting Arrow
entries: As part of a weapon attack involving a bolt or arrow, you can split the shot to fly towards different enemies. When you cast this spell, make three attack rolls towards three different enemies. If they hit, they deal the normal weapon damage and effects that the bolt would have done.

components.m: a bolt or arrow

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, you create an additional bolt for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thunderous Echo
entries: You send out a reverberating blast of sound directed at a target within range. They must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, the target takes {@damage 1d6} thunder damage or half as much on a success.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Touch Soul
entries: You can touch a humanoid’s soul and connect in a way impossible through just talking. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, which it can choose to fail. If they fail, you learn one of the following:

items: The creature’s alignment, core beliefs and deepest motivations.
The creature’s true name and race.
Any prominent rivals or lovers.
A core memory that formed their identity as a person.

spell.name: Upsetting Onslaught

time.condition: which you take when an enemy dies

entries: You strike the fear into your enemies by bringing their focus on what’s left of their ally. Every enemy creature within 30 feet of where the creature died must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they fail, they drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for the duration.

While {@condition frightened} by this spell, a creature must make the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn’t have line of sight on you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

components.m: a gold coin soaked in blood

spell.name: Venomfire
entries: You temporarily transform your hands into large claws dripping with venom. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit they take {@damage 6d8} acid damage. In addition, they must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the duration.

While {@condition poisoned}, they take {@damage 3d6} acid damage and make another Constitution saving throw to resist the {@condition poisoned} effect. If they succeed, the {@condition poisoned} ends and the spell ends.

components.m: a drop of acid

spell.name: Witchfire
entries: You pull witchfire, white hot flames from the Feywild, out and inside the body of a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} radiant damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your bonus action to deal {@damage 3d12} radiant damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell’s range.

components.m: a sprig from the Feywild

spell.name: Zhudun's Prophecy
entries: You whisper fragments of prophecy seen in the blank face of the dead star Zhudun. Choose a creature within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, that creature takes {@damage 8d6} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened}. They are {@condition frightened} for 1 minute and can reroll the saving throw at the end of their turns.

ac.special: 13 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Seige Monster (Seige Weapon only)
entries: The fantastic machine deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Mountable (Vehicle only).
entries: The fantastic machine has a pilot seat that protects the driver. While inside, the creature has half cover and can use their action to take the attack action of the fantastic machine. In addition, if the driver uses their bonus action to control the Fantastic Machine, the movement happens on the driver's turn and not the Fantastic Machine's.

trait.name: Immutable Form (Golem only).
entries: The fantastic machine is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance (Golem only).
entries: The fantastic machine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The fantastic machine makes a number of slam or volley attacks equal to half this spell’s level (rounded down).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit {@dice 1d10 + 4} + the spell’s level bludgeoning damage

action.name: Volley (Seige Weapon only).
entries: {@atk rw} your spell attack to hit, reach 40ft./80ft., one target. Hit {@dice 1d10 + 4} + the spell’s level bludgeoning damage

action.name: Slow (Golem only, once per cast).
entries: The fantastic machine targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, a target can’t use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can’t make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

hp.special: 5 (Air Only) or 8 (Land or Water only) + three times bard level

trait.name: Flyby (Air Only)
entries: The beast doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

trait.name: Pack Tactics (Land and Water Only)
entries: The Wing Man has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of their allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The beast can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit {@damage 1d8 + 4} piercing or slashing damage.
